data.title: World News: Election Watch
data.text:
SLOVAKIA

COUNTRY Slovak Republic ELECTION TYPE Presidential DATE April 3, 2004 (First Round)

April 17, 2004 (Second Round, if necessary)

Story Tools:

At stake in this election:

The office of the president of the Slovak Republic.

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: President Rudolf SCHUSTER

Head of Government: Prime Minister Mikulas DZURINDA

Assembly: Slovakia has a unicameral National Council of the Slovak Republic (Narodna Rada Slovenskej Republiky) with 150 seats.

Description of electoral system:

The president is elected by direct popular vote for a five-year term.

Members of the National Council are elected according to a proportional representation system to serve four-year terms.

Results from the presidential race (Round Two):

Presidential Candidate: Ivan GAŠPAROVIC

Party: Movement for Democracy (HDZ) and SMER

Valid Votes: 1,079,592

Percent of Valid Votes: 59.91%

Presidential Candidate: Vladimir MECIAR

Valid Votes: 722,368

Percent of Valid Votes: 40.09%

Results from the presidential race (Round One):

Presidential Candidate: Vladimir MECIAR*

Party: Movement for a Democratic Slovakia-People’s Party (HZDS-LS)

Valid Votes: 650,242

Percent of Valid Votes: 32.74%

Presidential Candidate: Ivan GAŠPAROVIC*

Party: Movement for Democracy (HDZ) and SMER

Valid Votes: 442,564

Percent of Valid Votes: 22.28%

Presidential Candidate: Eduard KUKAN

Party: Slovak Democratic and Christian Union (SDKU)

Valid Votes: 438,920

Percent of Valid Votes: 22.10%

Presidential Candidate: Rudolf SCHUSTER

Party: Party of Civic Understanding (SOP)

Valid Votes: 147,549

Percent of Valid Votes: 7.43%

Presidential Candidate: František MIKLOŠKO

Party: Christian Democratic Movement (KDH)

Valid Votes: 129,414

Percent of Valid Votes: 6.52%

Presidential Candidate: Martin BÚTORA

Party: Independent

Valid Votes: 129,387

Percent of Valid Votes: 6.51%

Presidential Candidate: Ján KRÁLIK

Party: Democratic Left (SDL)

Valid Votes: 15,873

Percent of Valid Votes: 0.80%

Presidential Candidate: Jozef KALMAN

Party Bloc: Left Bloc

Valid Votes: 10,221

Percent of Valid Votes: 0.51%

Presidential Candidate: Július KUBÍK

Party: Independent

Valid Votes: 7,734

Percent of Valid Votes: 0.39%

Presidential Candidate: Josef ŠESTÁK

Party: Independent

Valid Votes: 6,785

Percent of Valid Votes: 0.34%

Presidential Candidate: Stanislav BERNÁT

Party: Independent

Valid Votes: 5,719

Percent of Valid Votes: 0.29%

Presidential Candidate: L'ubomir ROMAN

Party: New Citizen’s Alliance (ANO)

Valid Votes: 1,806

Percent of Valid Votes: 0.09%

*Note: MECIAR and GAŠPAROVIC will advance to the second round of elections scheduled on April 17, 2004.

When was the last presidential election?

The last presidential election was held on May 15, 1999, with a run-off election held on May 29. In the run-off election, Rudolf SCHUSTER of the Party of Civic Understanding (SOP) won 57.18% of the votes cast while Vladimir MECIAR of the Movement for a Democratic Slovakia (HZDS) won 42.8% of the votes cast.

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 5,430,033 (July 2003 estimate)

Number of registered voters: 4,204,899

Is there anything unique about this election that would be of interest to an international audience?

According to law, a 50% threshold is required to win the presidency in the upcoming elections. In the event that the requirement is not met in the first round, a second round will be held on April 17 between the top two candidates from the first round.

SOURCE: INTERNATIONAL FOUNDATION FOR ELECTION SYSTEMS (IFES)

FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: IFES ELECTIONGUIDE ONLINE
